what: An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API
title: An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API
text: goal imf.data provide interface IMF Data via IMF Data REST API.

title: An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API
An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API
code: library(imf.data)  # list all available time-series dt <- list_datasets() head(dt,3) #>            Id                         Description #> 1 BOP_2017M06 Balance of Payments (BOP), 2017 M06 #> 2  BOP_2020M3 Balance of Payments (BOP), 2020 M03 #> 3 BOP_2017M11 Balance of Payments (BOP), 2017 M11 # load IFS time-series IFS <- load_datasets("IFS")  # see possible values for dimension 'ref_area' tail(IFS$dimensions$ref_area) #>               Value                                      Description #> 273 1C_SRF_plus_EMU                               SRF (including EA) #> 274          1C_SRF                                    SRF Countries #> 275              F6                               Sub-Saharan Africa #> 276              7A WAEMU (West African Economic and Monetary Union) #> 277             A10                               Western Hemisphere #> 278             W00                  All Countries, excluding the IO  # get time-series for GDP of Portugal, with Annual frequency x <- IFS$get_series(freq = "A", ref_area = "PT", indicator = "NGDP_D_IX") head(x) #>   TIME_PERIOD   A.PT.NGDP_D_IX #> 1        1995  65.121159550493 #> 2        1996 66.6781968283958 #> 3        1997 69.2687835398304 #> 4        1998 71.9183372769496 #> 5        1999 74.3423648876999 #> 6        2000 76.8850736800294 # load DOT time-series DOT <- load_datasets("DOT")  y <- DOT$get_series(freq = "M",                     ref_area = "PT",                     indicator = "TMG_CIF_USD",                     counterpart_area = c("B0","W00"),                     start_period = "2022-01-01",                     end_period = "2022-12-31") head(y) #>   TIME_PERIOD M.PT.TMG_CIF_USD.B0 M.PT.TMG_CIF_USD.W00 #> 1     2022-01         5899.209507          8592.410482 #> 2     2022-02         6625.214152          9306.561169 #> 3     2022-03         7271.456185         10056.201211 #> 4     2022-04         6639.368158          9427.777556 #> 5     2022-05         7095.966482         10432.681421 #> 6     2022-06          6778.13623         10180.535376

what: imf.data: An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API — imf.data-package
title: imf.data: An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API — imf.data-package
text: straightforward interface accessing IMF (International Monetary Fund) data JSON API, available https://data.imf.org/. package offers direct access primary API endpoints: Dataflow, DataStructure, CompactData. , provides intuitive interface exploring available dimensions attributes, well querying individual time-series datasets. Additionally, package implements rate limit API calls reduce chances exceeding service limits (limited 10 calls every 5 seconds) encountering response errors.

title: imf.data: An Interface to IMF (International Monetary Fund) Data JSON API — imf.data-package

List all available Time Series Datasets — list_datasets
code: list_datasets() #> Data service did not respond.

title: Loads Time Series Datasets — load_datasets
text: id character vector Dataset Series identifier. use_cache Boolean, defaults TRUE, TRUE reloads Dataset cached values.

title: Loads Time Series Datasets — load_datasets
text: dataset object time-series identifier, .e. list containing list 'dimensions' data.frames valid dimensions values, function 'get_series' retrieve time-series data.

title: Loads Time Series Datasets — load_datasets
code: IFS <- load_datasets("IFS") #> Data service did not respond. DOT <- load_datasets("DOT") #> Data service did not respond.  DOT$get_series(freq = "M",                ref_area ="GB",                indicator = "TMG_CIF_USD",                counterpart_area = c("B0","W00"),                start_period = "2022-01-01",                end_period = "2022-12-31") #> Dataset not loaded.   DTS <- load_datasets(c("DOT","IFS")) #> Data service did not respond. #> Data service did not respond.

what: Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
title: Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
text: Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' get Dataset time series

title: Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
code: mt_compact_data(id, dimensions, start_period = NA, end_period = NA)

title: Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
text: id Dataset Series identifier. dimensions named list dimensions query. start_period time series start date formats. end_period time series end date format. See Details valid formats.

title: Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
Calls API endpoint 'CompactData' to get Dataset time series — mt_compact_data
code: mt_compact_data("IFS", list("M", "GB", "PMP_IX")) #> Data service did not respond. mt_compact_data("IFS", list("M", "GB", "PMP_IX"), start_period = "2000-01") #> Data service did not respond. mt_compact_data("DOT", list("M","GB", "TMG_CIF_USD", c("B0","W00"))) #> Data service did not respond.

title: Calls API endpoint 'DataStructure' — mt_data_structure
code: mt_data_structure("DOT") #> Data service did not respond.

title: Calls API endpoint 'Dataflow' — mt_dataflow
code: mt_dataflow() #> Data service did not respond.
